class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang-json theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;json\&quot; name=\&quot;Update Database (JSON)\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;// PATCH /v1/databases/:database_id\n{\n  &amp;quot;icon&amp;quot;: {\n    &amp;quot;file_upload&amp;quot;: {&amp;quot;id&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;...&amp;quot;}\n  },\n  &amp;quot;properties&amp;quot;: {\n    &amp;quot;Restocked (new)&amp;quot;: {\n      &amp;quot;type&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;checkbox&amp;quot;,\n      &amp;quot;checkbox&amp;quot;: {}\n    },\n    &amp;quot;In stock&amp;quot;: null\n  },\n  &amp;quot;title&amp;quot;: [{&amp;quot;text&amp;quot;: {&amp;quot;content&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;New Title&amp;quot;}}]\n}\n&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang-typescript theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;typescript\&quot; name=\&quot;Update Database (TS SDK)\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;const response = await notion.databases.update({\n  database_id: &amp;quot;...&amp;quot;,\n  icon: {file_upload: &amp;quot;...&amp;quot;},\n  properties: {\n    &amp;quot;Restocked (new)&amp;quot;: {\n      type: &amp;quot;checkbox&amp;quot;,\n      checkbox: {},\n    },\n    &amp;quot;In stock&amp;quot;: null,\n  },\n  title: [{text: {content: &amp;quot;New Title&amp;quot;}}],\n})\n&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;After (2025-09-03):&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;ul&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;Continue to use the Update Database API for attributes that apply to the database: &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;parent&lt;/code&gt;, &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;title&lt;/code&gt;, &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;is_inline&lt;/code&gt;, &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;icon&lt;/code&gt;, &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;cover&lt;/code&gt;, &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;in_trash&lt;/code&gt;.\n&lt;ul&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;&lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;parent&lt;/code&gt; can be used to move an existing database to a different page, or (for public integrations), to the workspace level as a private page. This is a new feature in Notion&amp;#x27;s API.&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;&lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;cover&lt;/code&gt; is not supported when &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;is_inline&lt;/code&gt; is &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;true&lt;/code&gt;.&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;/ul&gt;\n&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;Switch over to the Update &lt;em&gt;Data Source&lt;/em&gt; API to modify attributes that apply to a specific data source: &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;properties&lt;/code&gt; (to change database schema), &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;in_trash&lt;/code&gt; (to archive or unarchive a specific data source under a database), &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;title&lt;/code&gt;.\n&lt;ul&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;Changes to one data source&amp;#x27;s &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;properties&lt;/code&gt; doesn&amp;#x27;t affect the schema for other data source, even if they share a common database.&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;For relation properties&lt;/strong&gt;: You can no longer provide a &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;database_id&lt;/code&gt;. Notion continues to include both the &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;database_id&lt;/code&gt; and &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;data_source_id&lt;/code&gt; in the &lt;em&gt;response&lt;/em&gt; for convenience, but the &lt;em&gt;request&lt;/em&gt; object (to Update Data Source) must &lt;strong&gt;only contain &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;data_source_id&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;.&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;/ul&gt;\n&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;/ul&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;Example for updating a data source&amp;#x27;s title and properties (adding one new property and removing another):&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;div class=\&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar\&quot; role=\&quot;tablist\&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=\&quot;true\&quot; class=\&quot;CodeTabs_active\&quot; role=\&quot;tab\&quot; type=\&quot;button\&quot;&gt;Update Data Source (JSON)&lt;/button&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=\&quot;false\&quot; class=\&quot;\&quot; role=\&quot;tab\&quot; type=\&quot;button\&quot;&gt;Update Data Source (TS SDK)&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;CodeTabs-inner\&quot; role=\&quot;tabpanel\&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang-json theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;json\&quot; name=\&quot;Update Data Source (JSON)\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;// PATCH /v1/data_sources/:data_source_id\n{\n  &amp;quot;properties&amp;quot;: {\n    &amp;quot;Restocked (new)&amp;quot;: {\n      &amp;quot;type&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;checkbox&amp;quot;,\n      &amp;quot;checkbox&amp;quot;: {}\n    },\n    &amp;quot;In stock&amp;quot;: null\n  },\n  &amp;quot;title&amp;quot;: [{&amp;quot;text&amp;quot;: {&amp;quot;content&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;New Title&amp;quot;}}]\n}\n&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang-typescript theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;typescript\&quot; name=\&quot;Update Data Source (TS SDK)\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;// Update data source properties and title using SDK version\n// prior to v5 and setting `notionVersion` in the `Client` to\n// &amp;quot;2025-09-03&amp;quot;:\n\nconst response = await notion.request({\n  method: &amp;quot;patch&amp;quot;,\n  path: `data_sources/${dataSource.id}`,\n  data: {\n    properties: {\n      &amp;quot;Restocked (new)&amp;quot;: {\n        type: &amp;quot;checkbox&amp;quot;,\n        checkbox: {},\n      },\n      &amp;quot;In stock&amp;quot;: null\n    },\n  },\n  title: [{text: {content: &amp;quot;New Title&amp;quot;}}],\n})\n\n// After upgrading TS SDK to v5:\n\nconst response = await notion.dataSources.update({\n  properties: {\n    &amp;quot;Restocked (new)&amp;quot;: {\n      type: &amp;quot;checkbox&amp;quot;,\n      checkbox: {},\n    },\n    &amp;quot;In stock&amp;quot;: null,\n  },\n  title: [{text: {content: &amp;quot;New Title&amp;quot;}}],\n})\n&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;Example for updating a database&amp;#x27;s parent (to move it), and switch it to be inline under the parent page:&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;div class=\&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar\&quot; role=\&quot;tablist\&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=\&quot;true\&quot; class=\&quot;CodeTabs_active\&quot; role=\&quot;tab\&quot; type=\&quot;button\&quot;&gt;Update Data Source (JSON)&lt;/button&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=\&quot;false\&quot; class=\&quot;\&quot; role=\&quot;tab\&quot; type=\&quot;button\&quot;&gt;Update Data Source (TS SDK)&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;CodeTabs-inner\&quot; role=\&quot;tabpanel\&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang-json theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;json\&quot; name=\&quot;Update Data Source (JSON)\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;// PATCH /v1/databases/:database_id\n{\n  &amp;quot;parent&amp;quot;: {&amp;quot;type&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;page_id&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;page_id&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;NEW-PAGE-ID&amp;quot;},\n  &amp;quot;is_inline&amp;quot;: true\n}\n&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang-typescript theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;typescript\&quot; name=\&quot;Update Data Source (TS SDK)\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;const response = await notion.request({\n  method: &amp;quot;patch&amp;quot;,\n  path: `databases/${DATABASE_ID}`,\n  body: {\n    parent: {type: &amp;quot;page_id&amp;quot;, page_id: &amp;quot;NEW-PAGE-ID&amp;quot;},\n    is_inline: true,\n  }\n})\n\n// After upgrading TS SDK:\nconst response = await notion.dataSources.update({\n  parent: {type: &amp;quot;page_id&amp;quot;, page_id: &amp;quot;NEW-PAGE-ID&amp;quot;},\n  is_inline: true,\n})\n&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;h2 class=\&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;step-4-handle-search-results-with-data-sources\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-step-4-handle-search-results-with-data-sources\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Step 4: Handle search results with data sources&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to Step 4: Handle search results with data sources\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#step-4-handle-search-results-with-data-sources\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Before (2022-06-28):&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;ul&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;If any Notion users add a second data source to a database, existing integrations will not see any search results for that database.&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;/ul&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;After (2025-09-03):&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;ul&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;The &lt;a href=\&quot;/reference/search\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;Search&lt;/a&gt; API now only accepts &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;filter[&amp;quot;value&amp;quot;] = &amp;quot;page&amp;quot; | &amp;quot;data_source&amp;quot;&lt;/code&gt; instead of &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;&amp;quot;page&amp;quot; | &amp;quot;database&amp;quot;&lt;/code&gt; when providing a &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;filter[&amp;quot;type&amp;quot;] = &amp;quot;object&amp;quot;&lt;/code&gt;. Make sure to update the body parameters accordingly when upgrading to &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;2025-09-03&lt;/code&gt;.\n&lt;ul&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;Currently, the search behavior remains the same. The provided query is matched against the &lt;em&gt;database&lt;/em&gt; title, not the &lt;em&gt;data source&lt;/em&gt; title.&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;/ul&gt;\n&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;Similarly, the search API &lt;em&gt;response&lt;/em&gt; returns data source IDs &amp;amp; objects.\n&lt;ul&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;Aside from the IDs and &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;object: &amp;quot;data_source&amp;quot;&lt;/code&gt; in these entries, the rest of the object shape of search is unchanged.&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;Since results operate at the data source level, they continue to include &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;properties&lt;/code&gt; (database schema) as before.&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;If there are multiple data sources, all of them are included in the search response. Each of them will have a different data source ID.&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;/ul&gt;\n&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;/ul&gt;\n&lt;h2 class=\&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;step-5-upgrade-sdk-if-applicable\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-step-5-upgrade-sdk-if-applicable\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Step 5: Upgrade SDK (if applicable)&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to Step 5: Upgrade SDK (if applicable)\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#step-5-upgrade-sdk-if-applicable\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;\n&lt;blockquote class=\&quot;callout callout_info\&quot; theme=\&quot;üìò\&quot;&gt;&lt;h2 class=\&quot;callout-heading\&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=\&quot;callout-icon\&quot;&gt;üìò&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p&gt;Introducing &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;@notionhq/client&lt;/code&gt; v5&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;&lt;p&gt;v5 of the SDK is now available:&lt;/p&gt;&lt;ul&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;&lt;a href=\&quot;https://www.npmjs.com/package/@notionhq/client/v/5.0.0\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;NPM link&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;&lt;a href=\&quot;https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js/releases/tag/v5.0.0\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;GitHub release link&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;p&gt;If you see an even newer version (e.g. &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;v5.0.2&lt;/code&gt;) at the time you&amp;#x27;re following these steps, we recommend upgrading directly to the latest version to unlock more enhancements and bugfixes, making the upgrade smoother.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;If you&amp;#x27;re using &lt;a href=\&quot;https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;Notion&amp;#x27;s TypeScript SDK&lt;/a&gt;, and have completed all of the steps above to rework your usage of Notion&amp;#x27;s endpoints to fit the &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;2025-09-03&lt;/code&gt; suite of endpoints manually, we recommend completing the migration by upgrading to the next &lt;a href=\&quot;https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js/releases\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;major version release&lt;/a&gt;, v5.0.0, via your &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;package.json&lt;/code&gt; file (or other version management toolchain.)&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;The code snippets under Step 3 include the relevant syntax for the new &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;notion.dataSources.*&lt;/code&gt; and &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;notion.databases.*&lt;/code&gt; methods to assist in your upgrade. Go through each area where you used a manual &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;notion.request(...)&lt;/code&gt; call, and switch it over to use one of the dedicated methods. Make sure you&amp;#x27;re setting the Notion version at initialization time to &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;2025-09-03&lt;/code&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;Note that the &lt;a href=\&quot;/reference/get-databases\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;List databases (deprecated)&lt;/a&gt; endpoint, which has been removed since version &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; &amp;quot;bot&amp;quot;\n    }\n  ],\n  &amp;quot;attempt_number&amp;quot;: 1,\n  &amp;quot;entity&amp;quot;: {\n    &amp;quot;id&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;153104cd-477e-809d-8dc4-ff2d96ae3090&amp;quot;,\n    &amp;quot;type&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;page&amp;quot;\n  },\n  &amp;quot;data&amp;quot;: {\n    &amp;quot;parent&amp;quot;: {\n      &amp;quot;id&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;36cc9195-760f-4fff-a67e-3a46c559b176&amp;quot;,\n      &amp;quot;type&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;database&amp;quot;,\n      &amp;quot;data_source_id&amp;quot;: integration&quot;,&quot;definition&quot;:&quot;TODO&quot;},{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;608fecfe36b0ee0064a891b4&quot;,&quot;term&quot;:&quot;Public OAuth integration&quot;,&quot;definition&quot;:&quot;TODO&quot;}],&quot;variables&quot;:{&quot;user&quot;:{},&quot;defaults&quot;:[{&quot;apiSetting&quot;:&quot;638f9d0280103e0082e9167c&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;bearerAuth&quot;,&quot;scheme&quot;:&quot;bearer&quot;,&quot;source&quot;:&quot;security&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;http&quot;,&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;638f9d0480103e0082e9168b&quot;},{&quot;apiSetting&quot;:&quot;68b0eb656692c6ca306f6207&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;basicAuth&quot;,&quot;scheme&quot;:&quot;basic&quot;,&quot;source&quot;:&quot;security&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;http&quot;,&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;68b0eb706692c6ca306f622c&quot;},{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;latestNotionVersion&quot;,&quot;default&quot;:&quot;2025-09-03&quot;,&quot;source&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;60c02cf4f26fa80064c30a79&quot;},{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;baseUrl&quot;,&quot;default&quot;:&quot;https://api.notion.com&quot;,&quot;source&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;67eacd3871bd6ea1945108b3&quot;},{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;internalLatestNotionVersion&quot;,&quot;default&quot;:&quot;2025-09-03&quot;,&quot;source&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;68b1ec9cf1ab39431406b63c&quot;}]}},&quot;doc&quot;:{&quot;metadata&quot;:{&quot;image&quot;:[],&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;description&quot;:&quot;Notion has released API version 2025-09-03 , introducing support for multi-source databases, which requires updates to existing integrations due to non-backward compatibility, including changes to API operations and endpoints. Users must update their integrations to use data_source_id instead of database_id and adapt to new webhook events and SDK updates to prevent disruptions.&quot;,&quot;keywords&quot;:&quot;Notion API version upgrade, Notion database API updates, data sources, multiple sources, multiple data sources, datasources, Notion database upgrade&quot;,&quot;robots&quot;:&quot;index&quot;},&quot;mdx&quot;:{&quot;altBody&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;status&quot;:&quot;rdmd&quot;},&quot;api&quot;:{&quot;method&quot;:&quot;get&quot;,&quot;url&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;auth&quot;:&quot;required&quot;,&quot;params&quot;:[]},&quot;next&quot;:{&quot;description&quot;:&quot;Read the frequently asked questions for this API change:&quot;,&quot;pages&quot;:[{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;FAQs: Version 2025-09-03&quot;,&quot;slug&quot;:&quot;upgrade-faqs-2025-09-03&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;doc&quot;,&quot;category&quot;:&quot;Get started&quot;}]},&quot;algolia&quot;:{&quot;translationFailure&quot;:false,&quot;publishPending&quot;:false,&quot;recordCount&quot;:21,&quot;updatedAt&quot;:&quot;2025-09-28T15:48:07.993Z&quot;},&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;689d0d49af8975564d22f003&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Upgrading to Version 2025-09-03&quot;,&quot;icon&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;updates&quot;:[&quot;68d94afcafd88840c1c07c30&quot;],&quot;type&quot;:&quot;basic&quot;,&quot;slug&quot;:&quot;upgrade-guide-2025-09-03&quot;,&quot;excerpt&quot;:&quot;Learn how to upgrade your Notion API integrations to the latest API version&quot;,&quot;body&quot;:&quot;We‚Äôve released **Notion API version `2025‚Äë09‚Äë03`**, introducing first-class support for multi-source databases. This enables a single database to contain multiple linked data sources ‚Äî unlocking powerful new workflows. \n\nFor more information about data sources, see [our FAQs.](https://developers.notion.com/docs/upgrade-faqs-2025-09-03)\n\n**However, this change is not backwards-compatible.** Most existing database integrations must be updated to prevent disruptions.\n\n&gt; ‚ùóÔ∏è Code changes required\n&gt; \n&gt; If your integration is still using a previous API version and a user adds another data source to a database, **the following API actions will fail:** \n&gt; \n&gt; - Create page when using the database as the parent\n&gt; - Database read, write, or query\n&gt; - Writing relation properties that point to that database\n\n# What‚Äôs changing\n\n- Most API operations that used `database_id` now require a `data_source_id`\n- Several database endpoints have moved or been restructured to support the new data model\n\n# What this guide covers\n\n- A breakdown of what‚Äôs new and why it changed\n- A step-by-step migration checklist to safely update your integrations\n\n# Upgrade checklist\n\nUse this checklist to see exactly what must change before you bump Notion-Version to `2025-09-03`. \n\n### Required steps across all of your integrations\n\n1. Add a discovery step to fetch and store the `data_source_id` to use in subsequent API calls.\n2. Start sending `data_source_id` when creating pages or defining relations\n3. Migrate database endpoints to data sources.\n4. If you use the Search API, update result handling to process data source objects and possible multiple results per database\n5. If using the TypeScript SDK, upgrade to the correct version and set the new version in your client\n6. If using webhooks, handle the new shape and bump your subscription version\n\n&gt; üìò Developer action required\n&gt; \n&gt; These steps primarily require code changes in your repositories or low-code platform. They cannot be fully completed through the Notion integration management UI.\n\n# Step-by-step guide\n\n## Step 1: Add a discovery step to fetch and store the `data_source_id`\n\nFirst, identify the parts of your system that process database IDs. These may include:\n\n- Responses of list and search APIs, e.g. [Search](ref:search).\n- Database IDs provided directly by users of your system, or hard-coded based on URLs in the Notion app.\n- Events for integration webhooks (covered in the **Webhook changes** section below).\n\nFor each entry point that uses database IDs, start your migration process by introducing an API call to the new **Get Database API** (`GET /v1/databases/:database_id`) endpoint to retrieve a list of child `data_sources`. For this new call, make sure to use the `2025-09-03` version in the `Notion-Version` header, even if the rest of your API calls haven't been updated yet.\n\n```json Get Database (JSON)\n// GET /v1/databases/{database_id}\n// Notion-Version: \&quot;2025-09-03\&quot;\n// --- RETURNS --&gt;\n{\n  \&quot;object\&quot;: \&quot;database\&quot;,\n  \&quot;id\&quot;: \&quot;{database_id}\&quot;,\n  \&quot;title\&quot;: [/* ... */],\n  \&quot;parent\&quot;: {\n    \&quot;type\&quot;: \&quot;page_id\&quot;,\n    \&quot;page_id\&quot;: \&quot;255104cd-477e-808c-b279-d39ab803a7d2\&quot;\n  },\n  \&quot;is_inline\&quot;: false,\n  \&quot;in_trash\&quot;: false,\n  \&quot;created_time\&quot;: \&quot;2025-08-07T10:11:07.504-07:00\&quot;,\n  \&quot;last_edited_time\&quot;: \&quot;2025-08-10T15:53:11.386-07:00\&quot;,\n  \&quot;data_sources\&quot;: [\n    {\n      \&quot;id\&quot;: \&quot;{data_source_id}\&quot;,\n      \&quot;name\&quot;: \&quot;My Task Tracker\&quot;\n    }\n  ],\n  \&quot;icon\&quot;: null,\n  \&quot;cover\&quot;: null,\n  // ...\n}\n```\n```typescript Get Database (JS SDK)\nlet notion = new Client({\n  auth: \&quot;{ACCESS_TOKEN}\&quot;,\n  notionVersion: \&quot;2025-09-03\&quot;,\n})\n\nconst DATABASE_ID = \&quot;/* ... */\&quot;\n \ntry {\n  const response = await notion.request({\n    method: \&quot;get\&quot;,\n    path: `databases/${DATABASE_ID}`,\n  })\n  const dataSources = response.data_sources\n\n  // [{ id: \&quot;...\&quot;, name: \&quot;...\&quot; }, ...]\n  console.log(dataSources)\n\n  // In the existing, single-source database case, there will only\n  // be one data source.\n  const dataSource = dataSources[0]\n} catch (error) {\n  // Handle `APIResponseError`\n  console.error(error)\n}\n\n// ... Remaining code, not migrated yet.\n\nnotion = new Client({\n  auth: \&quot;{ACCESS_TOKEN}\&quot;,\n  notionVersion: \&quot;2022-06-28\&quot;,\n})\n\n// ...\n```\n\nTo get a data source ID in the Notion app, the settings menu for a database includes a \&quot;Copy data source ID\&quot; button under \&quot;Manage data sources\&quot;:\n\n[block:image]\n{\n  \&quot;images\&quot;: [\n    {\n      \&quot;image\&quot;: [\n        \&quot;https://files.readme.io/f2d0303a35d08c014d2ed7a171994fe410a8bd5a5b47706fe4b340a161d38c20-image.png\&quot;,\n        null,\n        \&quot;\&quot;\n      ],\n      \&quot;align\&quot;: \&quot;center\&quot;,\n      \&quot;sizing\&quot;: \&quot;300px\&quot;,\n      \&quot;border\&quot;: true\n    }\n  ]\n}\n[/block]\n\n\n\n\nHaving access to the data source ID (or rather, _IDs_, once Notion users start adding 2nd sources for their existing databases) for a database lets you continue onto the next few steps.\n\n## Step 2: Provide data source IDs when creating pages or relations\n\nSome APIs that accept `database_id` in the body parameters now support providing a specific `data_source_id` instead. This works for any API version, meaning you can switch over at your convenience, before or after upgrading these API requests to use `2025-09-03`:\n\n- Creating a page with a database (now: data source) parent\n- Defining a database relation property that points to another database (now: data source)\n\n### Create page\n\nIn the [Create a page](ref:post-page) API, look for calls that look like this:\n\n```json Create Page (JSON)\n// POST /v1/pages\n{\n  \&quot;parent\&quot;: {\n    \&quot;type\&quot;: \&quot;database_id\&quot;,\n    \&quot;database_id\&quot;: \&quot;...\&quot;\n  }\n}\n```\n```typescript Create Page (TS SDK)\nconst response = await notion.pages.create({\n  parent: {\n    type: \&quot;database_id\&quot;,\n    database_id: DATABASE_ID,\n  }\n})\n```\n\nChange these to use `data_source_id` parents instead, using the code from Step 1 to get the ID of a database's data source:\n\n```json Create Page (JSON)\n// POST /v1/pages\n{\n  \&quot;parent\&quot;: {\n    \&quot;type\&quot;: \&quot;data_source_id\&quot;,\n    \&quot;data_source_id\&quot;: \&quot;...\&quot;\n  }\n}\n```\n```typescript Create Page (TS SDK)\n// Get dataSource from Step 1\n\nconst response = await notion.request({\n  method: \&quot;post\&quot;,\n  path: \&quot;pages\&quot;,\n  body: {\n    parent: {\n      type: \&quot;data_source_id\&quot;,\n      data_source_id: dataSource.id,\n    },\n  }\n})\n```\n\n### Create or update database\n\nFor [database relation properties](ref:property-object#relation), the API will include both a `database_id` and `data_source_id` fields in the read path instead of just a `database_id`.\n\nIn the write path, switch your integration to only provide the `data_source_id` in request objects.\n\n```json Relation property response example\n\&quot;Projects\&quot;: {\n  \&quot;id\&quot;: \&quot;~pex\&quot;,\n  \&quot;name\&quot;: \&quot;Projects\&quot;,\n  \&quot;type\&quot;: \&quot;relation\&quot;,\n  \&quot;relation\&quot;: {\n    \&quot;database_id\&quot;: \&quot;6c4240a9-a3ce-413e-9fd0-8a51a4d0a49b\&quot;,\n    \&quot;data_source_id\&quot;: \&quot;a42a62ed-9b51-4b98-9dea-ea6d091bc508\&quot;,\n    \&quot;dual_property\&quot;: {\n      \&quot;synced_property_name\&quot;: \&quot;Tasks\&quot;,\n      \&quot;synced_property_id\&quot;: \&quot;JU]K\&quot;\n    }\n  }\n}\n```\n\nNote that [database mentions](ref:rich-text#database-mention-type-object) in rich text will continue to reference the database, not the data source.\n\n## Step 3: Migrate database endpoints to data sources\n\nThe next step is to migrate each existing use of database APIs to their new data source equivalents, taking into account the differences between the old `/v1/databases` APIs and new `/v1/data_sources` APIs:\n\n- Return very similar responses, but with `object: \&quot;data_source\&quot;`, starting from `2025-09-03`\n- Accept a specific **data source ID** in query, body, and path parameters, not a database ID\n- Exist under the `/v1/data_sources` namespace, starting from version `2025-09-03`\n  - Require a custom API request with `notion.request` if you're using the TypeScript SDK, since we won't upgrade to SDK v5 until you get to Step 4 (below).\n\nThe following APIs are affected. Each of them is covered by a sub-section below, with more specific Before vs. After explanations and code snippets:\n\n- [Retrieve a database](ref:retrieve-a-database)\n- [Query a database](ref:post-database-query)\n- [Create a database](ref:create-a-database)\n- [Update a database](ref:update-a-database)\n- [Search](ref:search)\n\n### Retrieve database\n\n**Before (2022-06-28):**\n\n- Retrieving a database with multiple data sources fails with a `validation_error` message.\n- **For relation properties**: across _all_ API versions, _both_ the `database_id` and `data_source_id` are now included in the response object.\n\n```json Retrieve Database (JSON)\n// GET /v1/databases/:database_id\n{\n  // ...\n}\n```\n```typescript Query Database (TS SDK)\nconst response = await notion.databases.retrieve({\n  database_id: \&quot;...\&quot;,\n  // ...\n})\n```\n\n**After (2025-09-03):**\n\n- The Retrieve Database API is now repurposed to return a list of `data_sources` (each with an `id` and `name`, as described in Step 1).\n- The Retrieve _Data Source_ API is the new home for getting up-to-date information on the properties (schema) of each data source under a database.\n  - The `object` field is always `\&quot;data_source\&quot;` and the `id` is specific to the data source.\n  - The `parent` object now identifies the `database_id` immediate parent of the data source.\n  - The database's parent (i.e. the data source's grandparent) is included as a separate field, `database_parent`, on the data source response.\n  - You can't use a database ID with the retrieve data source API, or vice-versa. The two types of IDs are not interchangeable.\n\n```json Retrieve Data Source (JSON)\n// Get `data_source_id` from Step 1\n//\n// GET /v1/data_sources/:data_source_id\n{\n  \&quot;object\&quot;: \&quot;data_source\&quot;,\n  \&quot;id\&quot;: \&quot;bc1211ca-e3f1-4939-ae34-5260b16f627c\&quot;,\n  \&quot;created_time\&quot;: \&quot;2021-07-08T23:50:00.000Z\&quot;,\n  \&quot;last_edited_time\&quot;: \&quot;2021-07-08T23:50:00.000Z\&quot;,\n  \&quot;properties\&quot;: {\n    \&quot;In stock\&quot;: {\n      \&quot;id\&quot;: \&quot;fk%5EY\&quot;,\n      \&quot;name\&quot;: \&quot;In stock\&quot;,\n      \&quot;type\&quot;: \&quot;checkbox\&quot;,\n      \&quot;checkbox\&quot;: {}\n    },\n    \&quot;Name\&quot;: {\n      \&quot;id\&quot;: \&quot;title\&quot;,\n      \&quot;name\&quot;: \&quot;Name\&quot;,\n      \&quot;type\&quot;: \&quot;title\&quot;,\n      \&quot;title\&quot;: {}\n    }\n  },\n  \&quot;parent\&quot;: {\n    \&quot;type\&quot;: \&quot;database_id\&quot;,\n    \&quot;database_id\&quot;: \&quot;6ee911d9-189c-4844-93e8-260c1438b6e4\&quot;\n  },\n  \&quot;database_parent\&quot;: {\n    \&quot;type\&quot;: \&quot;page_id\&quot;,\n    \&quot;page_id\&quot;: \&quot;98ad959b-2b6a-4774-80ee-00246fb0ea9b\&quot;\n  },\n  // ... (other properties omitted)\n}\n```\n```typescript Retrieve Data Source (TS SDK)\n// Get dataSource from Step 1\n\nconst response = await notion.request({\n  method: \&quot;get\&quot;,\n  path: `data_sources/${dataSource.id}`,\n  // ...\n})\n\n// After upgrading TS SDK:\nconst response = await notion.dataSources.retrieve({\n  data_source_id: dataSource.id,\n})\n```\n\n### Query databases\n\n**Before (2022-06-28):**\n\n```json Query Database (JSON)\n// PATCH /v1/databases/:database_id/query\n{\n  // ...\n}\n```\n```typescript Query Database (TS SDK)\nconst response = await notion.databases.query({\n  database_id: \&quot;...\&quot;,\n  // ...\n})\n```\n\n**After (2025-09-03):**\n\nWhen you update the API version, the path of this API changes, and now accepts a data source ID. With the TS SDK, you'll have to switch this to temporarily use a custom `notion.request(...)`, until you upgrade to the next major version as part of Step 4.\n\n```json Query Data Source (JSON)\n// PATCH /v1/data_sources/:data_source_id/query\n{\n  // ...\n}\n```\n```typescript Query Data Source (TS SDK)\n// Get dataSource from Step 1\n\nconst response = await notion.request({\n  method: \&quot;post\&quot;,\n  path: `data_sources/${dataSource.id}/query`,\n  // ...\n})\n\n// After upgrading TS SDK:\nconst response = await notion.dataSources.query({\n  data_source_id: dataSource.id,\n  // ...\n})\n```\n\n### Create database\n\n**Before (2022-06-28):**\n\n- In `2022-06-28`, the Create Database API created a database and data source, along with its initial default view.\n- **For relation properties**: across _all_ API versions, _both_ the `database_id` and `data_source_id` are now included in the response object.\n  - When providing relation properties in a request, you can either use `database_id`, `data_source_id`, or both, prior to making the API version upgrade.\n  - We recommend starting by switching your integration over to passing only a `data_source_id` for relation objects even in `2022-06-28` to precisely identify the data source to use for the relation and be ready for the `2025-09-03` behavior.\n\n```json Create Database (JSON)\n// POST /v1/databases\n{\n  \&quot;parent\&quot;: {\&quot;type\&quot;: \&quot;page_id\&quot;, \&quot;page_id\&quot;: \&quot;...\&quot;},\n  \&quot;properties\&quot;: {...},\n  // ...\n}\n```\n```typescript Create Database (TS SDK)\nconst response = await notion.databases.create({\n  parent: {type: \&quot;page_id\&quot;, page_id: \&quot;...\&quot;},\n  properties: {...},\n  // ...\n})\n```\n\n**After (2025-09-03):**\n\n- Continue to use the Create Database API even after upgrading, when you want to create both a database and its initial data source.\n  - `properties` for the initial data source you're creating now go under `initial_data_source[properties]` to better separate data source specific properties vs. ones that apply to the entire database.\n  - Other parameters apply to the database and continue to be specified at the top-level when creating a database (`icon`, `cover`, `title`).\n- Only use the new Create Data Source API to add an additional data source (with a new set of `properties`) to an existing database.\n- **For relation properties**: You can no longer provide a `database_id`. Notion continues to include both the `database_id` and `data_source_id` in the _response_ for convenience, but the _request_ object must **only contain `data_source_id`**.\n\n```typescript Create Database with initial data source (JSON)\n// POST /v1/databases\n{\n  \&quot;initial_data_source\&quot;: {\n    \&quot;properties\&quot;: {\n      // ... (Data source properties behave the same as database properties previously)\n    }\n  },\n  \&quot;parent\&quot;: {\&quot;type\&quot;: \&quot;workspace\&quot;, \&quot;workspace\&quot;: true} | {\&quot;type\&quot;: \&quot;page_id\&quot;, \&quot;page_id\&quot;: \&quot;...\&quot;},\n  \&quot;title\&quot;: [...],\n  \&quot;icon\&quot;: {\&quot;type\&quot;: \&quot;emoji\&quot;, \&quot;emoji\&quot;: \&quot;üöÄ\&quot;} | ...\n}\n```\n```typescript Create Database with initial data source (TS SDK)\nconst response = await notion.request({\n  method: \&quot;post\&quot;,\n  path: \&quot;databases\&quot;,\n  body: {\n    initial_data_source: {\n      properties: {\n        // ... (Data source properties behave the same as database properties previously)\n      }\n    },\n  },\n  parent: {type: \&quot;workspace\&quot;, workspace: true} | {type: \&quot;page_id\&quot;, page_id: \&quot;...\&quot;},\n  title: [...],\n  icon: {type: \&quot;emoji\&quot;, emoji: \&quot;üöÄ\&quot;} | ...\n}\n  \n})\n\n// After upgrading TS SDK:\nconst response = await notion.databases.create({\n  data_source_id: dataSource.id,\n})\n```\n\n### Update database\n\n**Before (2022-06-28):**\n\n- In `2022-06-28`, the Update Database API was used to update attributes that related to both a database and its data source under the hood. For example, `is_inline` relates to the database, but `properties` defines the schema of a specific data source.\n- **For relation properties**: across _all_ API versions, _both_ the `database_id` and `data_source_id` are now included in the response object.\n  - When providing relation properties in a request, you can either use `database_id`, `data_source_id`, or both, prior to making the API version upgrade.\n  - We recommend starting by switching your integration over to passing only a `data_source_id` for relation objects even in `2022-06-28` to precisely identify the data source to use for the relation and be ready for the `2025-09-03` behavior.\n\n```json Update Database (JSON)\n// PATCH /v1/databases/:database_id\n{\n  \&quot;icon\&quot;: {\n    \&quot;file_upload\&quot;: {\&quot;id\&quot;: \&quot;...\&quot;}\n  },\n  \&quot;properties\&quot;: {\n    \&quot;Restocked (new)\&quot;: {\n      \&quot;type\&quot;: \&quot;checkbox\&quot;,\n      \&quot;checkbox\&quot;: {}\n    },\n    \&quot;In stock\&quot;: null\n  },\n  \&quot;title\&quot;: [{\&quot;text\&quot;: {\&quot;content\&quot;: \&quot;New Title\&quot;}}]\n}\n```\n```typescript Update Database (TS SDK)\nconst response = await notion.databases.update({\n  database_id: \&quot;...\&quot;,\n  icon: {file_upload: \&quot;...\&quot;},\n  properties: {\n    \&quot;Restocked (new)\&quot;: {\n      type: \&quot;checkbox\&quot;,\n      checkbox: {},\n    },\n    \&quot;In stock\&quot;: null,\n  },\n  title: [{text: {content: \&quot;New Title\&quot;}}],\n})\n```\n\n**After (2025-09-03):**\n\n- Continue to use the Update Database API for attributes that apply to the database: `parent`, `title`, `is_inline`, `icon`, `cover`, `in_trash`.\n  - `parent` can be used to move an existing database to a different page, or (for public integrations), to the workspace level as a private page. This is a new feature in Notion's API.\n  - `cover` is not supported when `is_inline` is `true`.\n- Switch over to the Update _Data Source_ API to modify attributes that apply to a specific data source: `properties` (to change database schema), `in_trash` (to archive or unarchive a specific data source under a database), `title`.\n  - Changes to one data source's `properties` doesn't affect the schema for other data source, even if they share a common database.\n  - **For relation properties**: You can no longer provide a `database_id`. Notion continues to include both the `database_id` and `data_source_id` in the _response_ for convenience, but the _request_ object (to Update Data Source) must **only contain `data_source_id`**.\n\nExample for updating a data source's title and properties (adding one new property and removing another):\n\n```json Update Data Source (JSON)\n// PATCH /v1/data_sources/:data_source_id\n{\n  \&quot;properties\&quot;: {\n    \&quot;Restocked (new)\&quot;: {\n      \&quot;type\&quot;: \&quot;checkbox\&quot;,\n      \&quot;checkbox\&quot;: {}\n    },\n    \&quot;In stock\&quot;: null\n  },\n  \&quot;title\&quot;: [{\&quot;text\&quot;: {\&quot;content\&quot;: \&quot;New Title\&quot;}}]\n}\n```\n```typescript Update Data Source (TS SDK)\n// Update data source properties and title using SDK version\n// prior to v5 and setting `notionVersion` in the `Client` to\n// \&quot;2025-09-03\&quot;:\n\nconst response = await notion.request({\n  method: \&quot;patch\&quot;,\n  path: `data_sources/${dataSource.id}`,\n  data: {\n    properties: {\n      \&quot;Restocked (new)\&quot;: {\n        type: \&quot;checkbox\&quot;,\n        checkbox: {},\n      },\n      \&quot;In stock\&quot;: null\n    },\n  },\n  title: [{text: {content: \&quot;New Title\&quot;}}],\n})\n\n// After upgrading TS SDK to v5:\n\nconst response = await notion.dataSources.update({\n  properties: {\n    \&quot;Restocked (new)\&quot;: {\n      type: \&quot;checkbox\&quot;,\n      checkbox: {},\n    },\n    \&quot;In stock\&quot;: null,\n  },\n  title: [{text: {content: \&quot;New Title\&quot;}}],\n})\n```\n\nExample for updating a database's parent (to move it), and switch it to be inline under the parent page:\n\n```json Update Data Source (JSON)\n// PATCH /v1/databases/:database_id\n{\n  \&quot;parent\&quot;: {\&quot;type\&quot;: \&quot;page_id\&quot;, \&quot;page_id\&quot;: \&quot;NEW-PAGE-ID\&quot;},\n  \&quot;is_inline\&quot;: true\n}\n```\n```typescript Update Data Source (TS SDK)\nconst response = await notion.request({\n  method: \&quot;patch\&quot;,\n  path: `databases/${DATABASE_ID}`,\n  body: {\n    parent: {type: \&quot;page_id\&quot;, page_id: \&quot;NEW-PAGE-ID\&quot;},\n    is_inline: true,\n  }\n})\n\n// After upgrading TS SDK:\nconst response = await notion.dataSources.update({\n  parent: {type: \&quot;page_id\&quot;, page_id: \&quot;NEW-PAGE-ID\&quot;},\n  is_inline: true,\n})\n```\n\n## Step 4: Handle search results with data sources\n\n**Before (2022-06-28):**\n\n- If any Notion users add a second data source to a database, existing integrations will not see any search results for that database.\n\n**After (2025-09-03):**\n\n- The [Search](ref:search) API now only accepts `filter[\&quot;value\&quot;] = \&quot;page\&quot; | \&quot;data_source\&quot;` instead of `\&quot;page\&quot; | \&quot;database\&quot;` when providing a `filter[\&quot;type\&quot;] = \&quot;object\&quot;`. Make sure to update the body parameters accordingly when upgrading to `2025-09-03`.\n  - Currently, the search behavior remains the same. The provided query is matched against the _database_ title, not the _data source_ title.\n- Similarly, the search API _response_ returns data source IDs &amp; objects.\n  - Aside from the IDs and `object: \&quot;data_source\&quot;` in these entries, the rest of the object shape of search is unchanged.\n  - Since results operate at the data source level, they continue to include `properties` (database schema) as before.\n  - If there are multiple data sources, all of them are included in the search response. Each of them will have a different data source ID.\n\n## Step 5: Upgrade SDK (if applicable)\n\n&gt; üìò Introducing `@notionhq/client` v5\n&gt; \n&gt; v5 of the SDK is now available:\n&gt; \n&gt; - [NPM link](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@notionhq/client/v/5.0.0)\n&gt; - [GitHub release link](https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js/releases/tag/v5.0.0)\n&gt; \n&gt; If you see an even newer version (e.g. `v5.0.2`) at the time you're following these steps, we recommend upgrading directly to the latest version to unlock more enhancements and bugfixes, making the upgrade smoother.\n\nIf you're using [Notion's TypeScript SDK](https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js), and have completed all of the steps above to rework your usage of Notion's endpoints to fit the `2025-09-03` suite of endpoints manually, we recommend completing the migration by upgrading to the next [major version release](https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js/releases), v5.0.0, via your `package.json` file (or other version management toolchain.)\n\nThe code snippets under Step 3 include the relevant syntax for the new `notion.dataSources.*` and `notion.databases.*` methods to assist in your upgrade. Go through each area where you used a manual `notion.request(...)` call, and switch it over to use one of the dedicated methods. Make sure you're setting the Notion version at initialization time to `2025-09-03`.\n\nNote that the [List databases (deprecated)](ref:get-databases) endpoint, which has been removed since version `2022-02-22`, is no longer included as of v5 of the SDK.\n\n## Step 6: Upgrade webhooks (if applicable)\n\n### Introducing webhook versioning\n\nWhen creating, editing, or viewing an [integration webhook subscription](ref:webhooks) in Notion's integration settings, there's a new option to set the **API version** that applies to events delivered to your webhook URL:\n\n[block:image]\n{\n  \&quot;images\&quot;: [\n    {\n      \&quot;image\&quot;: [\n        \&quot;https://files.readme.io/dea8af87f7abbb9f51a0cce55aa59a6087fb3641376471a2168d4636c84f8a9e-image.png\&quot;,\n        null,\n        \&quot;Screenshot of the integration webhook \\\&quot;Edit subscription\\\&quot; form, with the new \\\&quot;API version\\\&quot; dropdown menu.\&quot;\n      ],\n      \&quot;align\&quot;: \&quot;center\&quot;,\n      \&quot;border\&quot;: true,\n      \&quot;caption\&quot;: \&quot;Screenshot of the integration webhook \\\&quot;Edit subscription\\\&quot; form, with the new \\\&quot;API version\\\&quot; dropdown menu.\&quot;\n    }\n  ]\n}\n[/block]\n\n\nFor new webhook endpoints, we recommend starting with the most recent version. For existing webhook subscriptions, you'll need to carefully introduce support for the added and changed webhook types. Ensure your webhook handler can accept _both_ old &amp; new event payloads before using the \&quot;**Edit subscription**\&quot; form to upgrade to the `2025-09-03` API version.\n\nAfter you've tested your webhook endpoint to ensure the new events are being handled correctly for some period of time (for example, a few hours), you can clean up your system to only expect events with the updated shape. Read on below for specific details on what's changed in `2025-09-03`.\n\n### New and modified event types\n\nNew `data_source` specific events have been added, and the corresponding existing `database` events now apply at the **database** level.\n\nHere's a breakdown of how [event types](ref:webhooks-events-delivery) change names or behavior when upgraded to `2025-09-03`:\n\n[block:parameters]\n{\n  \&quot;data\&quot;: {\n    \&quot;h-0\&quot;: \&quot;Old Name\&quot;,\n    \&quot;h-1\&quot;: \&quot;New Name\&quot;,\n    \&quot;h-2\&quot;: \&quot;Description\&quot;,\n    \&quot;0-0\&quot;: \&quot;`database.content_updated`\&quot;,\n    \&quot;0-1\&quot;: \&quot;`data_source.content_updated`\&quot;,\n    \&quot;0-2\&quot;: \&quot;Data source's content updates\&quot;,\n    \&quot;1-0\&quot;: \&quot;`database.schema_updated`\&quot;,\n    \&quot;1-1\&quot;: \&quot;`data_source.schema_updated`\&quot;,\n    \&quot;1-2\&quot;: \&quot;Data source's schema updates\&quot;,\n    \&quot;2-0\&quot;: \&quot;N/A (new event)\&quot;,\n    \&quot;2-1\&quot;: \&quot;`data_source.created`\&quot;,\n    \&quot;2-2\&quot;: \&quot;New data source is added to an existing database  \\n  \\n`entity.type` is `\\\&quot;data_source\\\&quot;`\&quot;,\n    \&quot;3-0\&quot;: \&quot;N/A (new event)\&quot;,\n    \&quot;3-1\&quot;: \&quot;`data_source.moved`\&quot;,\n    \&quot;3-2\&quot;: \&quot;Data source is moved to a different database  \\n  \\n`entity.type` is `\\\&quot;data_source\\\&quot;`\&quot;,\n    \&quot;4-0\&quot;: \&quot;N/A (new event)\&quot;,\n    \&quot;4-1\&quot;: \&quot;`data_source.deleted`\&quot;,\n    \&quot;4-2\&quot;: \&quot;Data source is deleted from a database  \\n  \\n`entity.type` is `\\\&quot;data_source\\\&quot;`\&quot;,\n    \&quot;5-0\&quot;: \&quot;N/A (new event)\&quot;,\n    \&quot;5-1\&quot;: \&quot;`data_source.undeleted`\&quot;,\n    \&quot;5-2\&quot;: \&quot;Data source is undeleted  \\n  \\n`entity.type` is `\\\&quot;data_source\\\&quot;`\&quot;,\n    \&quot;6-0\&quot;: \&quot;`database.created`\&quot;,\n    \&quot;6-1\&quot;: \&quot;(unchanged)\&quot;,\n    \&quot;6-2\&quot;: \&quot;New database is created with a default data source\&quot;,\n    \&quot;7-0\&quot;: \&quot;`database.moved`\&quot;,\n    \&quot;7-1\&quot;: \&quot;(unchanged)\&quot;,\n    \&quot;7-2\&quot;: \&quot;Database is moved to different parent (i.e. page)\&quot;,\n    \&quot;8-0\&quot;: \&quot;`database.deleted`\&quot;,\n    \&quot;8-1\&quot;: \&quot;(unchanged)\&quot;,\n    \&quot;8-2\&quot;: \&quot;Database is deleted from its parent\&quot;,\n    \&quot;9-0\&quot;: \&quot;`database.undeleted`\&quot;,\n    \&quot;9-1\&quot;: \&quot;(unchanged)\&quot;,\n    \&quot;9-2\&quot;: \&quot;Database is undeleted\&quot;\n  },\n  \&quot;cols\&quot;: 3,\n  \&quot;rows\&quot;: 10,\n  \&quot;align\&quot;: [\n    \&quot;left\&quot;,\n    \&quot;left\&quot;,\n    \&quot;left\&quot;\n  ]\n}\n[/block]\n\n\n### Updates to parent data\n\nWith the `2025-09-03` version, all webhooks for entities that can have data sources as parents now include a new field `data_source_id` under the `data.parent` object.\n\nThis applies to:\n\n- Page events (`page.*`)\n- Data source events (the `data_source.*` ones listed above)\n- Database events (`database.*`), but **only** in rarer cases where databases are directly parented by another database (i.e. wikis)\n\nFor example, when a Notion user creates a page within a data source using the Notion app, the resulting `page.created` event has the following example shape (note the new `data.parent.data_source_id` field):\n\n```json\n{\n  \&quot;id\&quot;: \&quot;13950b26-c203-4f3b-b97d-93ec06319565\&quot;,\n  \&quot;workspace_name\&quot;: \&quot;Quantify Labs\&quot;,\n  \&quot;subscription_id\&quot;:
